availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Robert Clifford, Sr., and Nancy Azby Clifford. Married to Mildred Ingles Clifford in Harrison County, Kentucky, on March 22, 1864. Father of Mary Clifford. Farmer, with brothers Alexander Clifford, Edward Clifford, and William J. Clifford in Harrison County in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer, with William Clifford, in Harrison County in 1860. With William Clifford, owned four enslaved persons in trust in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 120B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 1104.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct 8, p. 532A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #20207.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, 1831-1892, Film #001690281.
"Robert Clifford (1832-1918)," Find A Grave, Memorial #15915327, accessed October 25, 2021, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/15915327.
